awd_titl_txt: CPS: Synergy: Image Modeling and Machine Learning Algorithms for Utility-Scale Solar Panel Monitoring
awd_abstract_narration:
The aim of this collaborative project is to increase the efficiency of utility scale solar arrays using sensors, machine learning and signal processing methods to detect faults and optimize power. New cyber-computing strategies, that rely on sensor data and imaging methods to predict solar panel shading, are used to improve efficiency.  A programmable 18kW testbed that consists of 104 panels equipped with sensors, actuators and cameras is used to validate all theoretical results and test new approaches for using solar analytics to optimize power generation.  Machine learning and dynamic image modeling algorithms are used to control each individual panel and change connection topologies to optimize power for different cloud, load, and fault conditions.

Outcomes of the CPS project include advances in: a) cloud movement modeling and shading prediction using computer vision algorithms, b) PV fault detection and optimization methods that will switch array topologies dynamically while limiting PV inverter transients, d) experimental (testbed) validation of all array monitoring methods, and e) secure wireless sensor and data fusion.  Theoretical and experimental research which enables real-time analytics and remote connection topology control may influence PV array standards and smart grid initiatives. The project tasks also include: education activities, outreach at high schools, and engagement with several organizations including minority and HBCU institutions to enhance diversity.
org_div_long_name: Division of Electrical, Communications and Cyber Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

por.por_cntn:
This CPS: Synergy project on Image Modeling and Machine Learning Algorithms for Utility-Scale Solar Panel Monitoring was completed in 2021.  The project had the following outcomes:

- The CPS team developed innovative methods for solar array monitoring and control that include:  a) using neural networks effectively for fault detection, b) using a machine learning approach for topology reconfiguration, c) developing imaging methods for shading prediction, and d) developing secure access algorithms for controlling the solar array testbed.

- A deep learning algorithm based on a neural network was designed to classify nine different Photovoltaic (PV) faults. The deep neural network (DNN) was applied on NREL PV data and we demonstrated that we can detect and classify faults with more than 90% accuracy. A provisional patent was established on the algorithm and a full patent is pending.  A paper on this topic appeared in the IEEE Access journal.

- A topology reconfiguration method was established which maximizes the power output of a PV array by using a neural network (NN).  The NN selects among four connection topologies based on shading conditions and this approach was shown to increase power output by more than 16%.   A provisional patent was established on this method and a full patent is pending.  The algorithm  was also published in the IEEE ICPS conference.

- Imaging and vision algorithms were developed to predict cloud movement and shading.  These algorithms provide advance information for topology reconfiguration. Different shading profiles are used to train algorithms for switching topologies.  A full patent was established and a journal paper was submitted to the IEEE PES journal.

- A Graph filter method for fault detection was developed. This method adopts a learning algorithm to split the original graph into subgraphs and reduces computation time in fault detection.  Results were presented at the IEEE ICPS conference.

- We designed an algorithm and a metric to improve intrusion detection to our solar testbed. The method uses keystroke dynamics.  A journal paper was submitted for publication.

- During the period of this CPS award, four PhD students, one Masters student, and two undergraduate students funded from REU supplements were trained.  

- The CPS award had significant broader impacts in that the machine learning algorithms developed can also be used in other application areas. Solar array monitoring software was produced and used for workforce development and training.  One startup company was launched.

- A book and several archival papers were published to disseminate CPS results.  Patents were established for technology transfer purposes.  Select products of this CPS grant are listed below:

Products:

Book: S. Rao, S. Katoch, V. Narayanaswamy, G. Muniraju, C. Tepedelenlioglu, A. Spanias, P. Turaga, R. Ayyanar, and D.Srinivasan, "Machine Learning for Solar Array Monitoring, Optimization, and Control,"  Synthesis Lectures on Power Electronics, Morgan &  Claypool,  Ed. J. Hudgins, Book, 91 pages, ISBN: 9781681739076, Aug. 2020.

Journal and Conference Publications:
S. Rao, G. Muniraju, C.  Tepedelenlioglu, D.  Srinivasan, G. Tamizhmani and A. Spanias, "Dropout and Pruned Neural Networks for Fault Classification in Photovoltaic Arrays,  pp. 120034-120042, IEEE Access, 2021.

G. Muniraju, S. Rao, S. Katoch, A. Spanias, C. Tepedelenlioglu,  P. Turaga, M. Banavar,  D. Srinivasan, ?A Cyber-Physical Photovoltaic Array Monitoring and Control System,?   24 pages, International Journal of Monitoring and Surveillance Technologies Research (IJMSTR), Volume 5, Issue 3, 2018.

J. Fan, S. Rao, G. Muniraju, C. Tepedelenlioglu, and A. Spanias, ?Fault Classification in Photovoltaic Arrays Using Graph Signal Processing,? in IEEE International Conference on Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems (ICPS), Tampere, June, 2020.

E.  Pedersen, S. Rao, S. Katoch, K. Jaskie, A. Spanias, Cihan Tepedelenlioglu, and E. Kyriakides, ?PV Array Fault Detection using Radial Basis Networks?, Proc. IEEE IISA-2019, Patras, July 2019.

Vivek Narayanaswamy, Raja Ayyanar, Andreas Spanias, Cihan Tepedelenlioglu,  "Connection Topology Optimization in PV Arrays using Neural Networks'," IEEE International Conference on Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems (ICPS), Taipei, May 2019.

Sunil Rao, Andreas Spanias, Cihan Tepedelenliglu, "Solar Array Fault Detection using Neural Networks", IEEE International Conference on Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems (ICPS), Taipei, May 2019..

Patents:
Systems and methods for skyline prediction for cyber-physical photovoltaic array control, S. Katoch, P. Turaga, A. Spanias, C. Tepedelenlioglu, Full US Patent 11,132,551, Issued Sept. 2021.

Systems And Methods For Connection Topology Optimization In Photovoltaic Arrays Using Neural Networks, Vivek Narayanaswamy, Raja Ayyanar, Andreas Spanias, Cihan Tepedelenlioglu, Provisional Patent US  62/808,677, 2019.

Solar Array Fault Detection, Classification and Localization Using Deep Neural Nets, S. Rao, A. Spanias, C. Tepedelenlioglu, Provisional Patent US 62/843,821, 2018.


Last Modified: 01/31/2022
Modified by: Andreas S Spanias

- The      CPS team developed innovative methods for solar array monitoring and control      that include:  a) using neural networks effectively for fault      detection, b) using a machine learning approach for topology      reconfiguration, c) developing imaging methods for shading prediction, and      d) developing secure access algorithms for controlling the solar array testbed.
